  • Method Details

    • validateUser

      public void validateUser(javafx.event.ActionEvent event) throws SQLException, IOException
      Validate User Method This method performs three main functions. Firstly, it checks the user entered username and password to see if there is a matching username-password pair in the database. If there is, they are taken to the next screen. If not, they are informed. Secondly, if the login attempt is successful, this method informs the user if they have any upcoming appointments. Lastly, this method appends all login attempts and times onto the login_activity.txt file. Both successful and unsuccessful attempts are logged.
      Parameters:
      event - performs action when clicked by user
      Throws:
      SQLException - for database access errors
      IOException - signals an I/O exception has occurred

    • initialize

      public void initialize(URL url, ResourceBundle resourceBundle)
      Initialize Method
      LAMBDA used to assign closing functionality to exit button. I chose to use make my code more concise. Instead of having an entire code block dedicated to an action listener for this button, the lambda makes the same result possible in a single line. This sets the exit button to call the chooseAlert method located in the Alerts class. Alert #29 displays a confirmation button that informs them that they are closing the program then exits the program if they confirm. This initialize method also translates the login page into French according to the system language.
      Specified by:
      initialize in interface javafx.fxml.Initializable
      Parameters:
      url - location to resolve relative paths
      resourceBundle - resources used to localize root object
